notesStmt.note: Eliyahu ben Yitsḥaḳ Yafet: inscribed, folio 2r.Folio 361v: a record of purchase of the manuscript, dated 1618, by Yitsḥaḳ ben Eliyah ben Avraham ben Simḥah ben Eliyah ha-Zaḳen, witnessed by , Yitsḥaḳ ben Mordekhai and Mordekhai ben Yeshu῾ah. Same folio, underneath: a note of sale of the manuscript, dated 5514 (1753), to Shelomoh.Folio 361v, side margin: a note signed by Mosheh ben Eliya ha-Levi.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A collection of works including Sefer yetsirah, with a commentary, and Karaite legal treatises.

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each. Folios 207-233 are numbered with Hebrew letters.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r A diagram of a solar system and of the sings of the Zodiac (partly cut away).

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Sepher Yetsirah. Aaron Ha-Rishon on the Prophets & Psalms. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1263.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Fischl Hirsch: purchased by the British Museum from him on 13 December 1873: inscribed (folio 362v).
